intro: Cerastium pentandrum subsp. tetrandrum, commonly known as the four-stamen mouse-ear, is a low-growing perennial plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its dense clusters of small, white flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant has basal leaves that are rounded and hairy, while the upper leaves are smaller and more lance-shaped. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its flowering period is typically from March to May, and it is often found in moist meadows and along riverbanks.
